org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge

Class VeluxBridgeScenes

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridgeScenes

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class VeluxBridgeScenes
extends java.lang.Object
    The VeluxBridgeScenes represents a complete set of transactions for retrieving of any available scenes into a structure VeluxExistingScenes defined on the Velux bridge.

    It provides the following methods:

    • getScenes(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridge) for retrieval of information.
    • getChannel() for accessing the retrieved information.
    • autoRefresh(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridge) for retrieval of information in case of an empty list of actuators.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution
    See Also:
    VeluxScene, VeluxExistingScenes, VeluxBridgeProvider

    • Constructor Detail

      • VeluxBridgeScenes

        public VeluxBridgeScenes()
        Constructor.

        Initializes the internal data structure channel of Velux scenes, which is publicly accessible via the method getChannel().

    • Method Detail

      • getChannel

        public VeluxBridgeScenes.Channel getChannel()
        Provide access to the internal structure of scenes.
        Returns:
        a channel describing the overall scenes situation.

      • getScenes

        public boolean getScenes(VeluxBridge bridge)
        Login into bridge, retrieve all scenes and logout from bridge based on a well-prepared environment of a VeluxBridgeProvider. The results are stored within a public structure VeluxExistingScenes.
        Parameters:
        bridge - Initialized Velux bridge (communication) handler.
        Returns:
        true if successful, or false otherwise.

      • autoRefresh

        public boolean autoRefresh(VeluxBridge bridge)
        In case of an empty list of recognized scenes, the method will initiate a product retrieval using getScenes(VeluxBridge).
        Parameters:
        bridge - Initialized Velux bridge (communication) handler.
        Returns:
        true if at lease one scene was found, and false otherwise.
